summary:
I am an independent cultural manager, art curator and design promotor with 20 years experience. A creative and energetic thinker and problem solver, used to work in fast pace environments where academic and organizational skills such as research, write, manage staff, customers, contractors, and financials are required to execute a variety of cultural events and commercial projects. I have consistently curated, organized and promoted gallery, museum, traveling and commercial exhibitions, as well as symposia, panel discussions, workshops and other events on time and within budget. 

As a Co-Founder and Chief Curator for the Otro Diseño Foundation, I developed skills in marketing, installing exhibitions, devising projects, gallery management, scheduling and programming. I executed projects that connect designers, high-end craft producer and emerging markets.

I have worked with museums and galleries such as Museum of Art and Design, NYC; Estonian Museum Of Applied Art And Design, Tallin; Arocena Museum, Torreón; Museum of Modern Art, Mexico City, among many others. I have obtained grants by the National Fund for Culture and Arts (Mexico), Prins Claus Foundation and Mondrian Foundation (Netherlands).

With an extensive knowledge in jewellery history and design I successfully implemented and managed a jewellery design and manufacturing company with yearly revenues of over € 1,000.000 from the second year.

BA in Architecture from the National Autonomous University Mexico; MA in Museography from the National Institute of Anthropology and History Mexico; MA degree in Museology from the Reinwardt Academy in Amsterdam.


OBJECTIVE

Joining a reputable company or organizations interested in disruptive innovation and ethical practices  to successfully create and execute cultural and commercial projects by utilizing my creativity, network and experience and where I can further improve my existing skills while enriching my curatorial and business practices.

[{'company': {'id': None, 'name': 'Privilege of Travel', 'logo': None, 'url': None, 'employees': {'start': None, 'end': None}}, 'date': {'start': {'month': 1, 'day': None, 'year': 2005}, 'end': {'month': None, 'day': None, 'year': None}}, 'profile_positions': [{'location': 'Hilversum, The Netherlands', 'date': {'start': {'month': 1, 'day': None, 'year': 2005}, 'end': {'month': None, 'day': None, 'year': None}}, 'company': 'Privilege of Travel', 'description': None, 'title': 'Cosnultant', 'employment_type': None}, {'location': 'Amsterdam Area, Netherlands', 'date': {'start': {'month': 1, 'day': None, 'year': 2016}, 'end': {'month': None, 'day': None, 'year': None}}, 'company': 'Privilege of Travel', 'description': None, 'title': 'Director of Branding & Guest Experience', 'employment_type': None}]}, {'company': {'id': 1281652, 'name': 'Otro Diseño', 'logo': None, 'url': 'https://www.linkedin.com/company/otro-dise-o/', 'employees': {'start': None, 'end': None}}, 'date': {'start': {'month': 1, 'day': None, 'year': 2007}, 'end': {'month': None, 'day': None, 'year': None}}, 'profile_positions': [{'location': 'Amsterdam Area, Netherlands', 'date': {'start': {'month': 1, 'day': None, 'year': 2007}, 'end': {'month': None, 'day': None, 'year': None}}, 'company': 'Otro Diseño', 'description': 'The Otro Diseño Foundation is a Dutch organization, founded in 2006 in Amsterdam, the Netherlands and with headquarters in Hilversum and representations in Mexico, Chile and Brazil. The Foundation is dedicated to the conceptualization and development of projects that promote the exchange of ideas, expertise and resources among designers and jewellery makers from Latin American and Europe.

The Foundation’s mission is to promote understanding and appreciation of design as a tool to encourage cultural communication and to improve the life of people around the world. Focusing on the converging fields of art and design, the Otro Diseño Foundation aims to inspire artists and designers from diverse cultural backgrounds to work in cooperation and the public to experience and enjoy fresh, innovative and meaningful design. Otro Diseño realizes this mission through outstanding exhibitions and events, research initiatives, promotion of innovative design products and exchange projects that merge a diverse international audience through its extensive network and cultural partnerships.    

With a strong emphasis on contemporary jewellery, the Otro Diseño Foundation explores the richness and diversity of design trough the world. Design that is original and inventive, resourceful and refined: the result of a mixture of people, ideas and cultures.

Otro Diseño has successfully organized two editions of the Latin American Design Biennale in Amsterdam, the Gray Area Symposium Mexico 2010, and various exhibition projects like Southern Divas, Extremely White and Come Diseño, among several others.', 'title': 'Co-founder and Member of the Board', 'employment_type': None}]}, {'company': {'id': None, 'name': 'Punto Crítico', 'logo': None, 'url': None, 'employees': {'start': None, 'end': None}}, 'date': {'start': {'month': 1, 'day': None, 'year': 2015}, 'end': {'month': 1, 'day': None, 'year': 2017}}, 'profile_positions': [{'location': 'Mexico City Area, Mexico', 'date': {'start': {'month': 1, 'day': None, 'year': 2015}, 'end': {'month': 1, 'day': None, 'year': 2017}}, 'company': 'Punto Crítico', 'description': 'PUNTOCRITICO© provides service supporting museums, galleries and other cultural venues in the acquisition or production ofexhibitions that explore cultural formats in which the convergence and integration of disciplines such as contemporary art, design, photography, craft and new media are primary forces for critical engagement; and where the public is able to become involved in the various stages of the curatorial and artistic process as much as with the final product. PUNTOCRITICO radical reconfiguration of traditional models and places for accessing art.

Inspired by the term coined by the Rod Island School of Design, Critical Making, PUNTOCRITICO deals with a cultural production that comes from a place of criticality and materiality and is able to propose a deeper and multileveled engagement with the audience. PUNTOCRITICO fosters projects that portrait meaningful trans-disciplinary practices in which advanced conceptual reasoning, a deep understanding of popular social, cultural, political and environmental matters, exceptional production skills and attention to both process and execution are paramount.

Our mission is to encourage museums, cultural institutions and the public arena, to create platforms for conversations that highlight the trans-disciplinary practices, interconnected dynamics and transnational nature of the contemporary cultural production in order to promote critical thinking, meaningful making and to provide the tools for closer interactions between makers, curators and audience.', 'title': 'Concept Developer & Project Manager', 'employment_type': None}]}]
